sub_topic: Determining the solubility of a substance in a solvent
message_1: What is the maximum amount of NaCl that can dissolve in 100 mL of water at 25°C?
message_2: The solubility of NaCl (sodium chloride) in water at 25°C is approximately 36 grams per 100 mL of water. Therefore, the maximum amount of NaCl that can dissolve in 100 mL of water at 25°C is 36 grams.
